cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northward across the northeastern Gulf of Mexico toward the western Florida Panhandle, then expected to track inland across Alabama and Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Florida Panhandle (near Panama City–Apalachicola area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Navarre to the Wakulla/Jefferson County line (FL Panhandle)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning from Indian Pass to Yankeetown (FL Gulf coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle and Big Bend, then inland over southeast Alabama and western/central Georgia
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty winds 20–30 mph possible in outer rainbands; sustained tropical-storm-force winds unlikely
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side near Jacksonville
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer bands may deliver 1–2 inches of rain, locally up to 3 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased rip-current risk along northeast Florida beaches
